<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning and welcome to September. </strong>It might be time to retire the pandemic-era phrase, "there's nothing going on." </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/spotifys-exclusive-agreement-joe-rogan-begins-september-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Spotify’s Podcast Library Just Got 2,500 Hours Longer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Joe Rogan podcast Spotify " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjc3L2pvZV9yb2dhbl9wb2RjYXN0X3Nwb3RpZnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In May, Joe Rogan shocked the podcasting world when he agreed to an exclusive $100 million licensing deal with Spotify. Today, his podcast <em>The Joe Rogan Experience</em> debuts on the platform.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There's a lot at stake</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just about two years ago, Spotify shifted its eye of Sauron toward the small but growing podcasting industry. In a <a href="https://newsroom.spotify.com/2019-02-06/audio-first/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a> from early last year, CEO Daniel Ek said he realized that “audio—not just music—would be the future of Spotify.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spotify had 185,000 podcasts on its platform in 2018; now it has over 1.5 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, Spotify filled its shopping cart with podcast companies Gimlet Media and Anchor for $340 million before <a href="https://variety.com/2020/digital/news/spotify-acquires-the-ringer-196-million-cash-bill-simmons-1203502471/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">snapping up</a> Bill Simmons’s sports and entertainment media-factory The Ringer for $200 million in February. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Thus began a podcast talent shopping spree</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company’s highest-profile get has undoubtedly been the hundred million dollar man Joe Rogan and his <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/19/21263927/joe-rogan-spotify-experience-exclusive-content-episodes-youtubehttps://www.theverge.com/2020/5/19/21263927/joe-rogan-spotify-experience-exclusive-content-episodes-youtube?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">190 million monthly downloads</a>. But for listeners who aren't into hunting or three-hour episodes, Spotify <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/meet-the-woman-who-got-joe-rogan-and-michelle-obama-to-spotify-11597138201?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also signed</a> megatalent like Michelle Obama and Kim Kardashian West to podcasting deals. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>All told, Spotify’s known investments in podcasts come to </span><span><a href="https://theconversation.com/michelle-obama-podcast-host-how-podcasting-became-a-multi-billion-dollar-industry-142920?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$696 million</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as it’s focused on bringing in new talent, Spotify may have overlooked its existing roster. One of the platform’s most popular exclusive podcasters, Joe Budden, <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/26/21403282/joe-budden-spotify-exclusive-leaving-host-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ripped Spotify</a> last week for “pillaging” his audience, accusing the company of leveraging his popularity to gain subscribers without properly compensating him. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Spotify’s interest in podcasts can be boiled down to one inconvenient truth: the music streaming business isn’t very profitable. Spotify loses nearly 75% of its revenue to royalties paid to record labels, music publishers, and other rights holders, writes the WSJ. As Rogan kicks off the new era of exclusive content, Spotify thinks it's got the arsenal to upend Apple's podcasting dominance.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/zooms-revenue-increases-355-second-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reading Zoom’s Earnings Report
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Joey from Friends being shocked" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=352 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/aWPGuTlDqq2yc/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Joey from Friends being shocked" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/aWPGuTlDqq2yc/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Zoom’s revenue <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/31/zoom-zm-earnings-q2-2021.html?__source=twitter%7Cmain&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew 355%</a> annually in Q2, because last year you hadn’t heard of the company and now you use it to watch your brother get married.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With its earnings coming in well above analysts’ (already bullish) expectations, Zoom’s stock gained roughly 23% after hours to hit a new record high. Shares had already jumped 369% on the year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We all know the story of Zoom: </strong>While the pandemic bulldozed some companies, it handed this upstart videoconferencing software company the <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/zoom-makes-as-much-money-in-three-months-as-it-did-in-all-of-2019-stock-heads-toward-more-records-2020-08-31?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gift of a lifetime</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Zoom made as much money in the last quarter as it did during all of 2019.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/zoom-q2-earnings-report-beat-expectations-revenue-growth-2020-8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a></span><span> its revenue guidance forecast for the year from around $1.8 billion to around $2.39 billion. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, Zoom is trying to take that gift and turn it into something lasting. It’s spent the last few months investing in R&D centers, hardware offerings, and seasoned execs across its business. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consider all that a massive moat-building project—it knows Big Tech is amassing the troops to storm the castle.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/nestle-acquires-maker-peanut-allergy-treatment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It’s Peanut Butter Therapy Time
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nestlé wants to help all those who just opt for Cracker Jacks at the ball game. Yesterday, the Swiss conglomerate <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nestle-buy-allergy-treatment-maker-072437086.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to buy</a> biotech Aimmune Therapeutics for $2.6 billion, specifically to get its hands on Aimmune’s peanut allergy treatment. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nestlé made its first investment in Aimmune in 2016, and already owned more than 25% of the company.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Aimmune’s treatment, called Palforzia, doesn’t rid the world of peanut allergies. It does help reduce the frequency and intensity of allergic reactions by exposing patients to small doses of peanut protein to build resistance.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nestlé says that 240 million people globally have food allergies, and peanuts are one of the most common. They affected almost 2.5% of American children, per a </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nestle-moves-further-into-health-buying-peanut-allergy-treatment-maker-11598860492?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2017 study</a></span><span> cited by the WSJ.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Palforzia is the first and only peanut allergy treatment approved by the FDA.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The acquisition is part of a larger strategy by Nestlé to shift its focus from grab bag consumer goods (like candy and bottled water) to the higher-margin health and wellness biz. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECOMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/amazon-secures-faa-approval-delivery-drone-program?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon’s Drone Program Gets a Lift
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="Amazon drone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjc5L2FtYXpvbl9kcm9uZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The traffic cops of the skies, the FAA, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/31/tech/amazon-drone-faa-approval/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handed Amazon</a> the all-important “air carrier” certificate it needs to operate a drone delivery network in the U.S. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yesterday's approval allows Amazon’s drones to carry packages beyond the line of sight of the operator. It’s a need-to-have badge in order to start commercial service. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The race for drone delivery is about as sluggish as George R.R. Martin’s writing process. Amazon first announced its drone plans in 2013, but technical challenges and regulatory delays have pushed an actual launch well into the 2020s. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The nowstory: </strong>Amazon is the third drone operator to secure FAA approval, joining UPS and Alphabet’s Wing unit. Regular commercial service <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2020-08-31/amazon-s-drone-delivery-fleet-hits-milestone-with-faa-clearance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t expected</a> for years, though. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And why does this matter? </strong>Amazon believes the future of ecommerce belongs to the company that can deliver packages before the confirmation email arrives in your inbox. Amazon’s <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/6/5/18654044/amazon-prime-air-delivery-drone-new-design-safety-transforming-flight-video?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new class of electric drones</a>, the MK27, can fly up to 15 miles and deliver a package weighing under 5 lbs. in less than 30 minutes. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/teslas-poststock-split-rally-propels-elon-third-wealthiest-person-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Elon's Rocket Ship Passes the Zuckmobile
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Hi Mark GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0HUldzuCa0S16SkM/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Hi Mark GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0HUldzuCa0S16SkM/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Elon Musk passed Mark Zuckerberg to become the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-31/elon-musk-is-now-richer-than-mark-zuckerberg-on-tesla-surge?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third wealthiest person in the world</a>. Propelled by Tesla’s never-ending rally, Musk joined the rarified centibillionare club populated only by Zuckerberg, Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, and Jeff Bezos.   </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">About that never-ending rally</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Anyone who opened their Robinhood account yesterday morning might have done a double-take after Tesla’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/30/tesla-apples-planned-stock-splits-go-effect-today?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5-1 stock split</a> took effect (cutting the company's stock price by 1/5). Despite a chorus of reminders that “stock splits don’t make a company more valuable,” Tesla's stock jumped another 12.5% yesterday, because when it comes to Tesla, everything's made up and the points don't matter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Tesla shares are up <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/31/apple-tesla-jump-as-stock-splits-take-effect.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 70%</a> since announcing its stock split on August 11 and almost 500% on the year. It’s now valued at $464 billion, which means Elon has added $87.8 billion to his net worth since the start of 2020.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Starting a business during a recession: </strong>It may not be as bad an idea as it sounds. <em>Business Casual </em>host Kinsey Grant argues in her debut column that companies founded during an economic downturn are more resilient in the long-run. <a href="https://column.businesscasual.fm/recessions-entrepenuership?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See if you agree</a>.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech Tip Tuesday:</strong> <a href="https://www.mentalfloss.com/article/623832/google-docs-tips-tricks-hacks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">13 tips</a> for using Google Docs like a pro and <a href="https://www.oberlo.com/blog/google-trends?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10 tricks</a> for mastering Google Trends.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Up: The Sequel</em>: </strong>Magician David Blaine plans to distract us all from 2020 by <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/david-blaine-postpones-helium-balloon-flight-relocates-stunt-nyc-arizona-n1238809?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tying 52 weather balloons to himself</a>. The prestige? When he floats about 18,000 feet above the Arizona desert. The stunt is streaming live on Blaine’s <a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/davidblaine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouTube channel</a> tomorrow at 6am PT. Get psyched by listening to <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NY3Zg37nIHo&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Joe Rogan’s recent interview of Blaine</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
UNCUT GEMS TRIVIA
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nSpotify’s Podcast Library Just Got 2,500 Hours Longer\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Joe Rogan podcast Spotify \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjc3L2pvZV9yb2dhbl9wb2RjYXN0X3Nwb3RpZnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn May, Joe Rogan shocked the podcasting world when he agreed to an exclusive $100 million licensing deal with Spotify. Today, his podcast \u003cem\u003eThe Joe Rogan Experience\u003c/em\u003e debuts on the platform.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere's a lot at stake\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust about two years ago, Spotify shifted its eye of Sauron toward the small but growing podcasting industry. In a \u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.spotify.com/2019-02-06/audio-first/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e from early last year, CEO Daniel Ek said he realized that “audio—not just music—would be the future of Spotify.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpotify had 185,000 podcasts on its platform in 2018; now it has over 1.5 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, Spotify filled its shopping cart with podcast companies Gimlet Media and Anchor for $340 million before \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2020/digital/news/spotify-acquires-the-ringer-196-million-cash-bill-simmons-1203502471/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esnapping up\u003c/a\u003e Bill Simmons’s sports and entertainment media-factory The Ringer for $200 million in February. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThus began a podcast talent shopping spree\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company’s highest-profile get has undoubtedly been the hundred million dollar man Joe Rogan and his \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/19/21263927/joe-rogan-spotify-experience-exclusive-content-episodes-youtubehttps://www.theverge.com/2020/5/19/21263927/joe-rogan-spotify-experience-exclusive-content-episodes-youtube?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e190 million monthly downloads\u003c/a\u003e. But for listeners who aren't into hunting or three-hour episodes, Spotify \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/meet-the-woman-who-got-joe-rogan-and-michelle-obama-to-spotify-11597138201?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso signed\u003c/a\u003e megatalent like Michelle Obama and Kim Kardashian West to podcasting deals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAll told, Spotify’s known investments in podcasts come to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://theconversation.com/michelle-obama-podcast-host-how-podcasting-became-a-multi-billion-dollar-industry-142920?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$696 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as it’s focused on bringing in new talent, Spotify may have overlooked its existing roster. One of the platform’s most popular exclusive podcasters, Joe Budden, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/26/21403282/joe-budden-spotify-exclusive-leaving-host-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eripped Spotify\u003c/a\u003e last week for “pillaging” his audience, accusing the company of leveraging his popularity to gain subscribers without properly compensating him. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSpotify’s interest in podcasts can be boiled down to one inconvenient truth: the music streaming business isn’t very profitable. Spotify loses nearly 75% of its revenue to royalties paid to record labels, music publishers, and other rights holders, writes the WSJ. As Rogan kicks off the new era of exclusive content, Spotify thinks it's got the arsenal to upend Apple's podcasting dominance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable married.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith its earnings coming in well above analysts’ (already bullish) expectations, Zoom’s stock gained roughly 23% after hours to hit a new record high. Shares had already jumped 369% on the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe all know the story of Zoom: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile the pandemic bulldozed some companies, it handed this upstart videoconferencing software company the \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/zoom-makes-as-much-money-in-three-months-as-it-did-in-all-of-2019-stock-heads-toward-more-records-2020-08-31?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egift of a lifetime\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eZoom made as much money in the last quarter as it did during all of 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/zoom-q2-earnings-report-beat-expectations-revenue-growth-2020-8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its revenue guidance forecast for the year from around $1.8 billion to around $2.39 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, Zoom is trying to take that gift and turn it into something lasting. It’s spent the last few months investing in R\u0026D centers, hardware offerings, and seasoned execs across its business. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsider all that a massive moat-building project—it knows Big Tech is amassing the troops to storm the castle.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNestlé wants to help all those who just opt for Cracker Jacks at the ball game. Yesterday, the Swiss conglomerate \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nestle-buy-allergy-treatment-maker-072437086.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed to buy\u003c/a\u003e biotech Aimmune Therapeutics for $2.6 billion, specifically to get its hands on Aimmune’s peanut allergy treatment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNestlé made its first investment in Aimmune in 2016, and already owned more than 25% of the company.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAimmune’s treatment, called Palforzia, doesn’t rid the world of peanut allergies. It does help reduce the frequency and intensity of allergic reactions by exposing patients to small doses of peanut protein to build resistance.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNestlé says that 240 million people globally have food allergies, and peanuts are one of the most common. They affected almost 2.5% of American children, per a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nestle-moves-further-into-health-buying-peanut-allergy-treatment-maker-11598860492?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2017 study\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e cited by the WSJ.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePalforzia is the first and only peanut allergy treatment approved by the FDA.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe acquisition is part of a larger strategy by Nestlé to shift its focus from grab bag consumer goods (like candy and bottled water) to the higher-margin health and wellness style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe traffic cops of the skies, the FAA, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/31/tech/amazon-drone-faa-approval/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehanded Amazon\u003c/a\u003e the all-important “air carrier” certificate it needs to operate a drone delivery network in the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday's approval allows Amazon’s drones to carry packages beyond the line of sight of the operator. It’s a need-to-have badge in order to start commercial service. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe race for drone delivery is about as sluggish as George R.R. Martin’s writing process. Amazon first announced its drone plans in 2013, but technical challenges and regulatory delays have pushed an actual launch well into the 2020s. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe nowstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon is the third drone operator to secure FAA approval, joining UPS and Alphabet’s Wing unit. Regular commercial service \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2020-08-31/amazon-s-drone-delivery-fleet-hits-milestone-with-faa-clearance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eisn’t expected\u003c/a\u003e for years, though. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd why does this matter? \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon believes the future of ecommerce belongs to the company that can deliver packages before the confirmation email arrives in your inbox. Amazon’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/6/5/18654044/amazon-prime-air-delivery-drone-new-design-safety-transforming-flight-video?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew class of electric drones\u003c/a\u003e, the MK27, can fly up to 15 miles and deliver style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Elon Musk passed Mark Zuckerberg to become the \u003ca Propelled by Tesla’s never-ending rally, Musk joined the rarified centibillionare club populated only by Zuckerberg, Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, and Jeff Bezos.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAbout that never-ending rally\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnyone who opened their Robinhood account yesterday morning might have done a double-take after Tesla’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/30/tesla-apples-planned-stock-splits-go-effect-today?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5-1 stock split\u003c/a\u003e took effect (cutting the company's stock price by 1/5). Despite a chorus of reminders that “stock splits don’t make a company more valuable,” Tesla's stock jumped another 12.5% yesterday, because when it comes to Tesla, everything's made up and the points don't matter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla shares are up \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/31/apple-tesla-jump-as-stock-splits-take-effect.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than 70%\u003c/a\u003e since announcing its stock split on August 11 and almost 500% on the year.
